Word.name: commodity
Word.Definition: articles of commerce

Word.name: rebate
Word.Definition: give a reduction in the price during a sale
join with a rebate
cut a rebate in (timber or stone)
a refund of some fraction of the amount paid
a rectangular groove made to hold two pieces together

Word.name: extraordinary
Word.Definition: beyond what is ordinary or usual; highly unusual or exceptional or remarkable
far more than usual or expected
(of an official) serving an unusual or special function in addition to those of the regular officials

Word.name: auction
Word.Definition: sell at an auction
the public sale of something to the highest bidder
a variety of bridge in which tricks made in excess of the contract are scored toward game; now generally superseded by contract bridge

Word.name: regular
Word.Definition: a regular patron
a dependable follower (especially in party politics)
a soldier in the regular army
a garment size for persons of average height and weight
conforming to a standard or pattern
in accordance with fixed order or procedure or principle
in accord with regular practice or procedure
not deviating from what is normal
relating to a person who does something regularly
officially full-time
occurring at fixed intervals
regularly scheduled for fixed times
(of solids) having clear dimensions that can be measured; volume can be determined with a suitable geometric formula
symmetrically arranged
(used of the military) belonging to or engaged in by legitimate army forces
not constipated
often used as intensifiers

Word.name: retail
Word.Definition: be sold at the retail level
sell on the retail market
the selling of goods to consumers; usually in small quantities and not for resale
at a retail price

Word.name: wholesale
Word.Definition: sell in large quantities
the selling of goods to merchants; usually in large quantities for resale to consumers
ignoring distinctions
at a wholesale price
on a large scale without careful discrimination

Word.name: barter
Word.Definition: exchange goods without involving money
an equal exchange

Word.name: agency
Word.Definition: the state of being in action or exerting power
the state of serving as an official and authorized delegate or agent
a business that provides a specialized service
an administrative unit of government
how a result is obtained or an end is achieved

Word.name: discount
Word.Definition: give a reduction in price on
bar from attention or consideration
an amount or percentage deducted
a refund of some fraction of the amount paid
the act of reducing the selling price of merchandise
interest on an annual basis deducted in advance on a loan

Word.name: tailored
Word.Definition: (of clothing) custom-made
severely simple in line or design

Word.name: massive
Word.Definition: consisting of great mass; containing a great quantity of matter
imposing in size or bulk or solidity
imposing in scale or scope or degree or power
being the same substance throughout

Word.name: license
Word.Definition: authorize officially
a legal document giving official permission to do something
the act of giving a formal (usually written) authorization
freedom to deviate deliberately from normally applicable rules or practices (especially in behavior or speech)
excessive freedom; lack of due restraint

Word.name: exhibit
Word.Definition: show; make visible or apparent
give an exhibition of to an interested audience
show an attribute, property, knowledge, or skill
walk ostentatiously
something shown to the public
an object or statement produced before a court of law and referred to while giving evidence

Word.name: ostentatious
Word.Definition: intended to attract notice and impress others
(of a display) tawdry or vulgar

Word.name: resemble
Word.Definition: appear like; be similar or bear a likeness to

Word.name: affluent
Word.Definition: an affluent person; a person who is financially well off
a branch that flows into the main stream
having an abundant supply of money or possessions of value

Word.name: anticipate
Word.Definition: regard something as probable or likely
be excited or anxious about
realize beforehand
act in advance of; deal with ahead of time
make a prediction about; tell in advance
be a forerunner of or occur earlier than

Word.name: appraise
Word.Definition: consider in a comprehensive way
evaluate or estimate the nature, quality, ability, extent, or significance of

Word.name: counterfeit
Word.Definition: make a copy of with the intent to deceive
a copy that is represented as the original
not genuine; imitating something superior

Word.name: emporium
Word.Definition: a large retail store organized into departments offering a variety of merchandise; commonly part of a retail chain

Word.name: warranty
Word.Definition: a written assurance that some product or service will be provided or will meet certain specifications
